screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .pln file in GRAPHISOFT Archicad 26
screenshot.caption: PLN file open in GRAPHISOFT Archicad 26

description: GRAPHISOFT Archicad is a building information modeling (BIM) program architects use to design building structures, interiors, exteriors, and landscapes. It includes many capabilities for designing, modeling, and collaborating.

PLN is the native format for Archicad projects. When you save a project as a PLN file, Archicad creates a PLN file to store the project contents. After saving the project, you can close it and re-open it to edit it further.

To create a PLN file, select File → New , modify the project, and select File → Save or Save as... . The software also allows you to save projects as .PLA archives, .BPN backup projects, and TPL project templates.
NOTE: Archicad only supports projects saved by version 8.1 or later of Archicad.

images.alt: Screenshot of a .pln file in GRAPHISOFT Archicad 26
images.caption: PLN file open in GRAPHISOFT Archicad 26
